It's beautifully decorated with a nice pool area with cabanas lining the second floor over the outside area, and you can still get a pretty good side view of the stage. However, my last experience there trying to get onto the dancefloor was insane. Even though the dancefloor was packed, it was almost impossible to try and even navigate it because the security guarding the dancefloor walkways wouldn't let you thru unless you were willing to pay them or show them some attention or skin -____- Disgusting! This was the first time I was ever expected of this inside of a club.. you would think they would hassle you with things like that if you were trying to get into the club or jump the line prior to entering... Other then that, the club itself is easy to navigate, and the restroom situation is pretty fast and short (avoid the cabana restrooms).

Hands down--- thee BEST club in Vegas.

They always have the best DJs, the best looking people and always offers the best time!

I love the gorgeous and open lay out of this club. I mean, it's huge! In my first review in 2011, I knew nothing! Girls! Always get on a guest list. Find them on IG,  through a girlfriend, heck ask me if you need, but guest list will save you a lot of time and money! Every Vegas trip, XS is always a must. During the summer they even have night swim on Sundays! So awesome! 

If it's your first time here, definitely explore. The club goes back really far! I love soaking my toes and dancing in the water at the end of the night. Great times are to be had here!

Guest list will only get you to the outside pool area and not the inside. But if you're a girl then it's a different story! Free access to anywhere inside and outside the pool area for the girls. 
My suggestion? Gentlemen buy the presale tickets beforehand because when the popular DJ comes to spin the music, it will get crowded. So avoid the traffic in the guest list line and the chaotic pool area and buy the ticket and enjoy the crowd and venue before it gets too packed to even breath! Trust me this had happened to my guy friends!! 

It's a great venue. Summer time it is perfect to chill outside. During the winter, it will get very cold to stay outside even with the heating lamp above your head. 

Bar: too much ice in every drink. My jack and coke ends up tasting like water down coke after couple mins. But don't you dare to ask for no ice or less ice because there is no point. All the bartenders are busy catering to 48192 people at the bar. (Just pregame before heading to the club)

OK, so I've been here like 3 times at least. And seriously, I don't mind the cover charge or the long lines. What I do mind is that now it's starting to turn Saturday night into "we've got the coolest celeb DJ" night (Tiesto, DeadMau5, Calvin Harris, etc.) This in turn means they close off the pool area and it's like 1000x more packed than it should be. It made it way more difficult to get around and they closed off the pool area. 
I hope this doesn't happen all the time now! The last time I came here was about 2 years ago and then probably 3 years ago before that. Anyway, I'm still giving it 4 stars because in my book XS was 5 stars, before starting to get all these DJs in. Now it just feels like I'm in the Sahara tent at Coachella.

When I come to Vegas, my tastes change. I want to go to that pretentious club, dress scantily, and drink the good stuff. This place met all my nightclub desires. 

* Beautiful layout, spilling into the vast pool area 
* Awesome periodic trance\/techno\/house music on the dance floor 
* Droves of Asian eye candy 
* Huge cabanas and poolside couches available for table service 
* Poolside gaming and full bar 
* Plenty of free seating in the pool area along benches.
* A hot tub for my tired feet 
* A drinking fountain (This is very important. Usually you have to pay for bottled water in Vegas nightclubs, but because we were at the pool, they have them.)

I agree with other Yelpers on the extremely crowded bars. It made me want to double fist drinks because of the long waits. 

Best people watching moment: when the Asian girl's pump sandal fell off her foot into the hot tub and she fell in trying to retrieve it. Very amusing! 

The only downside was the confusing, long line winding around several hallways. I got there 15 minutes before it even opened and there was a line. A really, really, really long line. Luckily, I only waited an hour and a half to get in. Geez. However, in being part of the "early" crowd, once I got in, it was easy access to the dance floor and bars. At about 1AM, I couldn't move around anymore. There must have been 8000 people at the club.

For me, this was the biggest party I've ever been to. Despite the long lines, I loved it and can't wait to go back. 

Tip for girls: Buy passes ahead of time on Ebay. Save $$$! Sorry guys, you have to pay full price.

Best Club in Vegas! Superlove Encore :)

Music is fabulous, great crowd & super fun atmosphere!  

Can't tell much, ya know what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas *wink wink*

Went back here for a ridiculous RL Grime and then Skrillex B2b Diplo set. It got ratchet.

Security and table wait staff show why XS is still showing the other kids in town how to run things.

I've been wanting to come here after hearing rave reviews from friends and have to say I just though it was OKAY.  Nothing to write home about, but I had to yelp it. =)

Came over after watching the fight and had to wait in a long ass line.  It moved pretty swiftly though which I was impressed about.  Then after paying $50 for the two of us, we head on in and immediately hit the bar.  It wasn't that crowded when we got there so the service was relatively quick.  We danced for a bit but the dance floor was INSANELY crowded and all these people kept trying to weave in and out which was annoying.

We decided to cool ourselves off with another drink and after going to the bar in the middle of the pool and waiting about 20 minutes with incompetent bartenders, we headed back to the main bar.  Danced a little, the place got way too crowded and we couldn't even dance anywhere, so we left.

DJ was good, drinks were good, way too crowded, and the GOGOs need a little help.

As far as Vegas nightclubs go, this is one I really enjoyed! It's a bit of a pain to enter when you have a group that includes guys and girls (they split you up into entirely different lines and the females generally get in quite a bit quicker than the males), but that's somewhat common in Vegas. The ladies got two free drink tickets, and their vodka pineapple drinks were tasty! My favorite thing about XS was the atmosphere. The outdoor club is beautiful (you're hanging out right by the expansive pools), and there were plenty of bars to easily grab a drink. My husband and I did a little gambling at the blackjack table by the main bar (I wouldn't recommend unless you have 100 dollars to lose haha) and the dealer was pretty unfriendly, but again that can be common. The pitfalls are definitely outweighed by how fun the environment is, and it's certainly a place I'd be happy to come back to next time I'm in Vegas!
Boom! Had a GREAT time last night, club is super legit, crowded, and fun! Door took care of us all, mad props, will be back.

If I could give it no stars I would. The drinks were watered down, the staff was rude, especially the people checking your IDs. All the guys were on power trips. Dude...you work the line at a club. You're not Secret Service. The only reason 1 star is even deserved is because the DJ was amazing. Don't waste your time here if you want to have good service and not be shoulder to shoulder 24\/7. Way too much of a not-so-good time. Go to Marquee where it's worth it.

This was probably the nicest club I went to in LV. Poles and stages everywhere.  My cousin knew a host so thank God, we didn't have to pay or stand in the 40 minute line woohoo! It was a beach theme the night I went to people were sent outside to the pool area. Gorgeous! There were cool seats floating on the sides of the pool, the bar right under a balcony.  The night we came, nobody seemed to have reserved the cabanas on the balcony so we pretty much just chilled up there.  The bouncers didn't even say anything!

However, the biggest negative for this club is the sucky music. How can such a nice club have such terrible playlist??? It would have been fun to get up and dance but the girls and I just didn't know how to dance to that type of music..so minus one star for XS.

But don't let the terrible music keep you away! Come early to take pictures then bounce to a club that plays better music!
Had a great time thanks to Carlos Reyes he is awesome always taking care of me and my peeps. Going again in March !!!! Thank you XS for always a great time!!!

Definitely a night club to visit in Vegas... 
It has Sunday event s like night swim .... 
If you choose bottle service definitely will be worth it as you have a place to chill and watch the drunk people and you be drinking yourself lol... Prices are not too high like OMNIA and Hakassan lol ...

XS = Excessive amounts of gorgeous girls and European\/Internationals.
TIP: Buy presale tickets on xs.wanttickets.com (cheaper than at the door for girls and guys).

Came here Saturday of Labor Day weekend and this place was packed- 20 minute wait for drinks. Girls were charged $30 at the beginning of the night.

GIRLS! You can soak your feet in the spa outside (outside to the left oft he dance floor, look for the circular little pool). The water is HOT but saved me from super sore feet the next day. 

Music: Still house-ish and not hip hop... and it will probably never be Hip Hop. 

Atmosphere: Gorgeous... only club where there's such a large outside area with planters to sit and a pool area to dip your feet. You can also gamble and just people watch if you get tired of the dance floor. 

Overall, this is a club is a must if you love house music and a gorgeous atmosphere, or a club to go to on a "I want to go clubbing but I want to take it easy tonight because we partied too hard the other nights" night b\/c of the large space.

Oh and the air conditioning system is AWESOME. I never sweated on the dance floor despite being packed like sardines because the air was blasting the whole time! The AC system was so great that all the girls' curly do's stayed and was perfect for the next day!

This is probably one of the most awesome club I've ever been to in Vegas. I mean, where else can you find a club with a casino, a pool, an open air dance floor, and go go girl cages. This literally has everything. Did I mention there are Cabanas too!!! 

Ok.. yes.. the lines are a bit long and the club is pretty enpensive. But hey.. Like I said, you get what you pay for. This is well worth it. The last time I came, we came for a bachelor party. Things got a bit out of hand, and we spent more than we should. But it was well worth it. 

We talked to the manager and we were able to get a center cabana in the middle of the floor along with bottle service. The weather was awesome and the outdoor temperture was just right. We got bottles after bottles of alcohol.. Our group was just having a blast. The bachelor had a great time and it was the highlight of our entire trip.

We bumped into a couple of my friends and a not so good experience happened to her in the club but fortunately they did have good security in place and they took good care of her. I was impressed on how well they have the place locked down even thou the place is pretty big. 

We had a blast and we felt safe the whole time. The crowd was pretty diverse and the music was pretty good. I highly recommend this place for all Vegas visitors who are looking to party hardy. Both the inside dance floor and the outside dance floor were crowded but not too stuffy. I would also recommend the inside boots too if you are going to buy one, but personally the outside cabanas are much better. You get a better view and more space. 

Happy partying.

This place is big enough to have two stages, so why was there only one?  They should take out the gambling tables and set up a DJ booth right there. It didn't make sense to me to PAY a cover and then go gamble? You can gamble ANYWHERE in Vegas, why would you do it at a club?

Other than that, this place is nice, super crowded dance floor. Later during the night when it got more packed, people were dancing in the pool. Cool.

Standing in line is poor. Get line passes and rock your best. Tons of bars means lots of not having to wait, which is great in Vegas. They have Blackjack and War, so sit, play and drink for free while you watch the 20 somethings make fool of themselves.

I want to say this is the best club ever,  but omg, this club is so overrated!!!

I was really excited to finally experience the XS hype, only to find out that the club does not live up to its hype.  Waiting in line already made me not like this place.  Our friends were a few parties ahead of us and yea it sucks that people cut to meet up with their friends, but whatever it happens and you do it, I do it and yep, that's what we were doing.  And then, a bouncer stopped us saying "you have to wait like everyone else."  okay, fine, we have to wait.  AND THEN, this bitch ass bouncer lets people cut for the party in front of us.....??????  thanks...for that?  later on that night i found out that one of my friends was not let in because the bouncer didn't believe her id was her.  it wasn't a fake id and the reason why they wouldnt let her in was because she said the wrong weight as written on the id.  ARE YOU SERIOUS?? its freaking vegas, she's with a bunch of girls and who really says their correct weight on their id??  and what bouncer really looks at the id anyways.  ugh i hated the bouncers there, thought they were so tough cuz they were working for the it spot in vegas.

the music sucked!!!!!!  for being one of the most popular clubs in vegas, i thought they would have played more hip hop, less house\/trance.  it was like weird remixes if they did play hip hop, so no thanks!

okay ill give credit to how big this place is.  it was nice that it had a spacious outdoors and how they had gambling tables within the club.  i liked how it had a lot of seating area as well.  everyone kept on saying, it was the nicest pace, but honestly i think its only the nicest because its one of the newest clubs....give it like another year....

2000th review my favorite club! Kaskade NYE 2013!! :D
Spacious and always the best DJs.
I love how there's an outdoor area and you can go to the pool as well.
Never had a bad night here!

Best club in all of Vegas.

We recently went to Vegas for a bachelor party and booked with XS.   This was the smartest thing we could have done since there was a ridiculous line wrapping around the casino.  However, our boy Kenny (the promoter) took care of us and had us in a jiffy.  He had us seated in a little nook near one of the main bars, that overlooked the outdoor pool and right in front of a stripper pole.

I think this club is approximately 6600 square feet.  It has an indoor area with 2 major bars and a huge dance area.  It also has an outdoor area with lounge chairs and boothes everywhere surrounding the pool and the tables.  Yes, there are tables to gamble at!  Also, there was a top level for those who booked boothes up there as well.  This club was packed and it seemed like everyone and anyone I knew was at that club.  On this particular night, I ran into old friend, current friends and past acquaintances that I had no idea was gonna be there.

However, unless you plan on waiting in line hoping to get in, be ready to shell out the cash.  I went in a group of 10 guys and we paid to get in and then wound up getting about 7 liters of grey goose.

This is a great spot to party in Vegas!  They are very lenient here.  They even let people get on other people's shoulders while fistpumping with their shirts off.  I guess that's the way it should be.  It's a great time.

Came to Vegas to see Lady Gaga in concert.  Got the hook up to stay at Encore for a great price.  Friend's connection got us stamped in to XS.

ATMOSPHERE:
Greeted by bodies coming out of a gold wall at the front door.  Inside was super crowded and hot (Sat night.)  The interior didn't impress me at all.  Pool area is beautiful and was less crowded because it was cold and windy.  Outdoor bar had 3 bartenders attending to about 100 people in no order at all.  Just gotta make your way to the front!  Amazing how loud the music is at the pool and obviously there's zero complaints from the rooms above.  

COVER:
We got comp'd in, but according to their website, guys pay $50 on weekends.  Geezuz.

DRINKS:
$10 canned Heineken, so not worth it.

OVERALL:
I'm getting too old for this shit.

Went here for my girl's birthday. We got hooked up and received easy access to get in with no lines and no waiting so of course that took a lot of the stress out of trying to get in. I heard it can get crazy trying to get in. All I can say is that that club is the best party I've ever had in any establishment. You can dance in the pool, the ladies were all over the couches and polls, no lines at the bars, huge dance floor, random people making it rain and throwing money everywhere, waitresses walking around with shots ready to purchase and take....the list goes on.

Get in here with a party mentality and ENJOY!

XS is the best club that I've ever been to in my life for many reasons. 

1.) It's MASSIVE! There are a lot of places to sit and and a lot of places to explore. You're immediately welcomed with a large pool in the center, surrounded by lounge chairs and "beds." The interior and dance floor is definitely a site to see. 

2.) You can always tell a club is legit based on their bathrooms. The women's bathroom has plenty of stalls, so waiting in a long line to go potty is out of the question. There are also a variety of hair sprays and perfumes lined up along the sinks for much needed feminine touch-ups. A bathroom attendant is also there to hand you paper towels after you're finished washing your hands.

3.) There is a very shallow part of the pool where you can stick your feet in. This feels amazing after a long night of walking, dancing, and shoecide. It's also a great way to avoid those preying man whores because many of them aren't willing to take their shoes and socks off to get into the pool.  

Keep in mind to get on the guestlist, arrive early, and have an even guy\/girl ratio, otherwise you're not only going to have to empty your wallet to get into this club, but you're also going to have to wait in a 3 hour line. XS is the kind of club that you'd see in a movie or maybe even in a good dream. If you're in Vegas and are looking for a place to get your mind blown, XS would be at the top of my list.
Pathetic and ovehyed club. The main djs don't even show up. They extort money from you.

Decent venue, well run, drinks are about what you'd expect. Overall you need to go when there is a good DJ, we had some second rate DJs who aren't local, but aren't good. It was a fun time, but the music needs to be much better to really enjoy it.

I came here with my BFF on the last night of our Vegas vacation. OMG is all I can say. We walked in and the indoor area was totally empty...umm, ok, I thought. However, we made our way outside and I was thinking, "we've just entered Wonderland." It was a "night swim" night so there were lots of people frolicking in the pool. There were twinkling lights in the trees and house music blasting. Everyone in the place was DROP DEAD GORGEOUS.

BFF and I parked ourselves near one of the outdoor bars and had a few 13.00 cocktails (YIKES- it IS Vegas, after all. We HAD been given two free drink tickets each, though). We later moved to one of the low retaining walls around the "gardens." We laughed, cried, shared our dirty secrets, all surrounded by a glittering, pulsing, garden of loveliness. 

I am certain that this club will be on the top of my "must-gos" when I'm in Vegas. It is just amazing.

It ain't perfect - but if you ask me, XS is the standard-bearer when it comes to Vegas nightclubs. Even with stiff new competition popping up left & right, no other nightlife venue really seems to capture that "only in Vegas" vibe in the way that XS can. 

_____________

+ The venue itself is strikingly beautiful. There's gold hues, ambient lighting, & pulsing LEDs everywhere. For as photo-op friendly as it is, XS doesn't sacrifice practicality in the name of looking pretty; the club is surprisingly spacious. I also appreciate the abundant flow of fresh air; you don't get the trapped-in-a-cave sort of feeling found a la Hakkasan.

+ There's absolutely no shortage of ways to have fun at XS. We've done both general admission & the whole-nine-yards table service experience here before; both were equally memorable, which gives you an idea as to how well thought-out of a club this is. 

XS has a huge abundance of tables positioned both inside and outside of the club; we were fortunate enough to snag a table on the inside, positioned near the center dancefloor. The energy and acoustics inside this main dancefloor area are top-notch, although I will say that maneuvering around the dance floor is quite an uphill battle, especially during nights that feature A-list talent. 

And on that note - even the DJs themselves seem to recognize that there's something special about XS. We visited during EDC Week 2015 on a night when both Arty & Avicii performed; Arty played his trademark melodic house\/trance blend for about 2 hours, while Avicii kept the party rocking for close to 3 hours via a monstrous, thoughtful club set that I would've never expected to experience anywhere outside of Europe. We literally partied until the sun came up!

_____________

You don't have to spend a small fortune to have a good time here, however. 

Once the indoor part of the nightclub hits capacity, patrons who arrive later are basically required to congregate outside until space opens up inside the club (unless you've got table reservations!). Initially this proved a little frustrating for our group - until we realized that XS's poolside area offers a whole separate dimension for wild, nonstop partying.  

+ The club installed a towering new wall of LEDs & pyrotechnics that faces the pool\/outdoor area; the visuals blasting from this impressive piece of technology are all state-of-the-art, and it's quite cool to take a step back and watch the LED panels operate in sync with the colored lights positioned above the pool itself. You have to experience this setup for yourself; it looks every bit as expensive as it must have come out to be. 

+ The outdoor pool area also features multiple full-size bars with surprisingly short wait times; during our most recent visit, lines for drinks were virtually nonexistent - in spite of how packed the place was (for Avicii's final XS set!). The poolside area even features about a dozen card\/table games for those who are really feelin' it; we didn't partake during our visits, but on both occasions, we noticed that the tables were packed, and that those who were indulging looked like they were having a killer time.

____________

+ I've personally only been here twice, but the service at XS has always been a cut above the norm. Case in point - we're just about getting ready to leave the club during our most recent visit, and the girls in our group are beginning to really feel the burn from their heels. On a whim, my GF asks a bouncer if he could help us locate the nearest exit. 

In complete contrast to what I had been expecting, the bouncer radios in via his earpiece, and instructs to follow him. He made the crowd of clubgoers part like the Red Sea, escorting us single-file through the inside portion of the club to its front entrance\/exit. (Of course I got that brief adrenaline rush from catching envious glares from multiple angles as we were directed through the ocean of drunks!) 

+ After making sure that we were all accounted for at the club's front exit, this friendly bouncer smiled & wished us a "good evening." Of course, we gave him a bit of cash to thank him for his time...but this unexpected act of selflessness really stood out to me, especially in the "me first" sort of culture that's generally expected of Las Vegas nightclubs. Hats off to this gentleman for his kindness & generosity!

_____________

I can't say this enough - no nightclub out there really holds a candle to XS in terms of both the attention-to-detail and the overall level of service offered. Whenever I think "night out in Vegas," XS will surely be the first place that comes to mind.

I have such mixed feelings about this club. Back when it first opened years and years ago (this is when I start to feel old), it was the "it" club. It was fresh, fun, and my experiences were generally good. As the years passed by, my experiences started deteriorating and I noticed that the staff at the XS were becoming more and more unprofessional.

Ladies, if you are on the free guest list, go to the promotions line. Once you enter encore (where the taxi drops you off), go to your left. There are no clear signs anywhere so it can be very confusing at first. During my last experiences here, I have been given a lot of unnecessary attitude by the staff at the promotions line. I have also witnessed a lot of this attitude towards other girls, for no apparent reason at all! Please do not yell at us from across the room. It puts everyone in a bad mood. Also, the women handling the guest list were literally in T-shirts. I know it's not a huge deal, but when other clubs are stepping up their game and having their staff dress to impress, maybe XS should try to at least put in more effort.

Another thing to be peeved about: they don't let the guest list people have access to the inside of the club. Yes, seriously. I understand that you are trying to control the crowd, but you're only making the outside even more crowded. 

The three free drink tickets sound tempting, but if you have the option to...go to another club. I highly recommend Omnia.

This night club pool bar was having a D.J. Zedd was spinning for the Halloween Party last nite.

We knew not to show up until 12 or 1, since another jock would before he comes on ( I have seen how this works before).

To say it was cluster crowded was a understatement, they only had 2 small bars to serve 2000 people, the only table and seating available was the VIP
tables which cost thousands with bottle service!! I always get the VIP bottle service at most bars, especially in Vegas. But with just the two of us, it's a little expensive and I'm not called "One can Mary Ann" for no reason, one drink and I'm drunk, and I usually only drink Ace of Spades or Dom champagne or only Grey Goose Vodka. At my age I only drink and eat the best, I deserve it and can easily afford it.

I was really disappointed that they didn't have any champagne just the cheap well drinks, so my daughter and I just hung out and danced on the stripper pole.

This bar is located at the Encore, a Wynn property. I'm glad I've never stayed there, I probably would be disappointed too!

I came here last Saturday with 5 of my girlfriends. 5\/6 of us got stamped except for one of my girlfriends. They denied her because my girlfriend did not look like her picture in her passport and that her nose does not match. -__- Are you serious? Even though her picture was a couple of years younger, you can still see the resemblance. She even asked if she could show them her facebook page since this happened to her at club Tao and they let her through, but the bouncer said no. What is even worse is the day before, my friend's friend tried getting into XS but got denied with her own ID as well. In person, she is skinny with blonde hair, but in her ID, she was chubs with black hair. They basically denied her for getting hotter. -__-

Anyways, we decided to try Surrender and my girlfriend got in. I think I have more love for Surrender than XS now even though I love the ambiance for XS more. :\/ I guess you better update your ID picture if you decide to get fit\/fat\/dye your hair\/get a nose job\/etc or bring a back up ID photo or else they will deny you.

Went here on a Saturday in May to see David Guetta but never did.

The single star is for the club's aesthetics--as a premier Vegas nightclub, you expect a certain level of decor and XS did not disappoint. It has a large outdoor area with a pool, an inner section with the main dance floor (which you can see from the outer area), bars scattered everywhere, and many tables\/cabanas to reserve.

Now for the negative: 

It was a friggin maze trying to figure out where to actually enter the club. We had pre-purchased tickets online and went to the main entrance, and they sent us further down to a different entrance. We kept walking and walking until we essentially went in a circle around the Encore hotel before finally finding the entrance they wanted us to use and no one was helpful giving directions.

Next, the seating issue. Unless you dole out big bucks for a bottle service table, there is literally nowhere to sit once you're inside (so don't wear extremely high heels)! We were literally forced to sit on the edge of a planter where it was cramped and crowded because that was the only available place. 

Next, the drink prices. Ok, ok, it's Vegas and it's expensive, but I ordered a rum and coke and a vodka with pineapple juice for my friend and it was $38!!! Definitely milked that drink.

Finally, the actual show--which we had bought tickets for. The DJ booth is inside the inner area of the club which can have its own line to get into (so, yes...a line inside a line). We got there about 11 which was early so we had no problem getting into the inner area and ordering drinks. But with a couple hours to kill before the headliner and no seats, we went back to the outer area for a while. We noticed a line started forming to get back in the inner part so we got in it. The bouncer then let about 30 people in line inside and stopped the line with us about 10 people from the front. We thought we would get in soon after that but ended up stuck in that line for 2.5 hours (and never did get in)! The bouncer said they were at max capacity and kept pushing the time back: 60 more minutes, 90 more minutes, etc. So we just listened to the DJ from the line. Finally, at 1:10, the bouncer said the earliest we could get in  would be 2:30 so at that point we bailed. 

By the time we left, David Guetta hadn't showed and we learned later he never came because of the Billboard Music Awards the next day :( 

It was just an all-around bummer. The girls in our group spent a lot of time and money on our makeup, hair and outfits for a fun last night in Vegas and were left disappointed.

This is currently one of my favorite clubs in Las Vegas next to Pure. The layout is similar to Tryst at the Wynn, but the ambiance is a bit different. Instead of the dark reds that proliferate the walls of Tryst, XS has softer, light gold and cool blue tones. Instead of a giant waterfall as the main centerpiece, there is a big pool on the outside patio. I also love that there are couches and beds available outside that are not restricted to those who ordered VIP bottle service. 

My main gripe about this club is the fact that local ladies have to pay a cover charge, contrary to how most clubs treat local women in Vegas. I didn't have to pay because we knew a VIP host, but if I had to - I wouldn't go to this club simply out of principle. The music could've been better also. I went there on a Saturday night, and the majority of the songs were oldie hip hop from the 90's.

This is the best club I have EVER been to. It's really open so you don't get hot like at other clubs. It has multiple bars indoor and outdoor and great music. The atmosphere is beautiful-high ceilings, a huge pool and a good sized dance floor. 
This place is a guaranteed good time!

UHHHHHHHHH-MAAAZINGGGGG. so gorgeous. huge. LOVE IT. makes me drive 4 hours to vegas every other weekend. hotties everywhere. I will wait hours in line if I have to get in this place. I think once I waited like 40 minutes (with a flask obviously so I wasn't mad at all about waiting). but I love it here its just so pwetty :)

best club in sin city til this day. I've been to vegas 5x already this year and can't seem to get enough of this club.  went there on sunday for the night swim and it was off the hook! paid $30 to enter around 2am, inside dancefloor was closed off but the bars n restrooms still available.  sunday is for the true party animals so the atmosphere was great.  not sure if it was all the bikinis and darkness mixed together but everyone was beautiful. people dressed in both swimwear n club attire were in the pool. tables were open if u want to gamble. 

highly recommended to drop by here if ur still here on sunday. don't forget to check out saturdays as well.....its the fkcn shheeettt!

Definitely one of my favorite clubs in Vegeas... the most important thing to note is that there is an air conditioning vent, stage left, next to the first table by the stairs... this is where you want to dance because it gets pretty warm in there and the air conditioning is a life saver!

Ladies bring fold-able flats or flipflops in your purse so you can step out of your heels and play in the water!

XS is the best club I've ever been to at Vegas. The lines were incredibly long, but luckily they moved really quickly. Of course there were the people that bribed bouncers to get ahead of line, but really, if you're patient, just wait in line. It was only 40-50 min wait. What I would recommend is during this wait, bring a bottle of patron, a bottle of vodka, a bottle of your favorite alcohol and drink it in line. It is the best pre-party wait ever. Get tipsy before you get into the club, because once you get in the price of drinks is $13-15.. and they make the drinks pretty weak.

I stayed till 4, and there were STILL a lot of people there. That's how Vegas clubbing should be.

WOWZA.  That is all I can say.  We just bought a winter home here in Vegas, and I tried to avoid being a club rat as long as possible.  But then I slowly gave in...TAO, then Drai's, then Hakkasan, then finally: XS.  There is simply no comparison.  We went to XS for my birthday celebration, and from simple things like the ease of access, parking, our door contact guy got us in relatively quickly, and our table (even though it was outside and removed from the dance floor) was an absolute blast.  The decor is the best I've seen (the incredible reverse 3d gold female bust wall behind one of the bars is ridick!), the sound during Kaskade's performance was as if you were on the dance floor even though we were outside, people jumping in the pool fully clothed...it was just a great night.
I will be back again for sure.  I don't know how anybody compares Hakkasan to this, btw...it's just not even close.  They are somehow so much less pretentious than Hakkasan, it's way bigger, the dance floor is much more fun, the decor is so much better, the dance floor mist\/rotating chandelier\/the confetti\/the pyro is awesome....just everything: fabulous.  It was a perfect birthday weekend.  I can't wait to come back.  XS is what Vegas clubs should all try to live up to!

Beautiful club and good music.  This place was incredibly packed though (and I've been to some packed clubs) and there was (1) no space on the dance floor and (2) no space to stand because everything has been allocated to bottle service.  So, basically, unless you get bottle service, you shouldn't go there period.  I'm not giving it the lowest rating because I understand that it opens to the outside when the weather is nice and I imagine that it's much less crowded then.  Given the ambiance and the music, I would be definitely willing to try it again when it's a little warmer.

Like the other reviewers said, the place is like tryst, but has a much bigger exterior. you can actually go outside and there are seats around the pool area and an extra bar in the back. 

This is probably the best looking club I've been to but thier music sucks...I don't even remember what they played and I wasn't even drunk...
drinks are average, but what's great about the drinks is that they actually use the bigger cups which is better for your buck...The bartenders are crappy though..they don't know how to work the bar..they keep going back to one spot to serve and neglect the ones on the each side of
the bar...inefficient....plus they ignore you which doesnt help...

I would come back here just to chill, but not to dance though.

Hands down worst experience I have ever had. I created a yelp account just to write this review. I'm in the service industry and have never seen someone treated as bad as my friend was treated. Completely manhandled by their gorilla of a security guard for zero reason. She had maybe a bit too much fun yes. But was respectful and agreeing to leave peacfully. Being the friend who was more in controll I am talking to their late night manager who was cool at first and then by the end of everything mocking my drunk friend as she's trying to leave to no avail. I'm sorry that your life is so pathetic that you feel the need to make others feel this poorly about themselves. We were made to leave without any of her Belongings. cellphone and wallet included and then she was screamed at to put on clothing they did not allow us to go find. I Had A Meeting with a manager of the hotel the following day ( because that's how I want to spend my vacation) and was apologized to up and down and he helped us find her things in lost and found. He basically promised me the world .... a bunch of comps through an email.... I am still waiting for a week later. While your establishment is beautiful you completely lack people with managerial and skills and they lack compassion as well. I changed my entire vacation for midnight swim last Sunday the 17 th. ... and was really looking forward to that night while I take responsibility for my drunk friend.... no one put a gun to your staffs head and told them to work customer service . This comming from a bartender in a night club herself. ....we work hospitality because we enjoy making people happy. Clearly no one at that club. Is there for that reason. On top of all of this I was molested by a guest as my friend was being rudely escorted out and the staff acted as if it was a huge inconvince to even kick that guy out. First night in vegas was a huge upset due to the staff at XS. Thanks.
Sickest club ever. Everyone swims and throws around beach balls. The sickest djs come through and the staff\/environment isn't douchey and annoying like the majority of popular clubs.

Still going strong! Even though Surrender is new, I liked XS more, though some trouble may have occurred, harmless. LOL

So the line is crazy long! but if you're nice and patient, no worries. No need for a guestlist. Just dont be crazy late. We got there around 10. Waited no more than 20 minutes. Paid only $20 to get in. They don't have a so-called "guestlist" for XS on weekends. So come prepared. Well worth the wait. 

Well first off, I was sober and ate it right on the steps! Can i say get me a shot after that?!

Decor is nice, place is packed, but not overly baring. The bartender, she was super nice! She gave me water. The shots here are generous as well. They are double shots pretty much and amazing! Love it already.

Yes Paris Hilton was there. Yeah?!... but the music was awesome, not so much top 40s completely, which was a nice mix. Thank you!

This too is near the pool, just not as much as Surrender. All sorts of people are here, a good mix. More foreign though, if thats the right word. :)..

Nevertheless, decor great, music nice, booze delish! crowd, youre okay. A place to definitely get your groove on! I say I would come back. 

I understand it being a so-called "tourist" trap. However, thats what vegas is overall! You can't get away, and you cant deny it. It is what it is. 

However, I've had my fair share of vegas clubs, so far a fav!

Artist: Benny Benassi
Song: Satisfaction

Lyrics :

Push me
And then just touch me
Till I can get my satisfaction
Satisfaction, satisfaction, satisfaction, satisfaction

Push me
And then just touch me
Till I can get my satisfaction
Satisfaction, satisfaction, satisfaction, satisfaction

Push me
And then just touch me
Till I can get my satisfaction

Push me
And then just touch me
Till I can get my satisfaction

Push me
And then just touch me
Till I can get my satisfaction
Satisfaction, satisfaction, satisfaction, satisfaction, satisfaction

One of the best clubs in Vegas! Definitely check this place out if you're looking for a hot place to party it up! Beautiful people, dance floor, HUGE back outdoor area with a pool and cabanas... you name it this place has it!

I was here for the 3rd time this past weekend and let me tell you, it was not the most pleasant. It was at capacity x2! Plus I had arrived around 10 and waited for almost 45 minutes in line (you would think thats early in Vegas right?!)  I literally could not walk anywhere in this place, even getting to the restroom was a chore. I was saddened because my first 2 times here were awesome, memorable & fun. However, I do suggest you coming here and checking it out for yourself.... it's pretty damn awesome.

Beautiful decor, stiff drinks & everything you imagine a Vegas club too be. The whole guest list thing doesn't seem to apply here. I have been on one and not on one and have had to pay a cover each time. I feel somewhat ashamed since usually in Vegas girls don't have to pay. But I do recognize it's a business and I'd rather just be in there, then to make a big deal as too why I can't get in for free. So be prepared. Ohh and if they try to tell you they are giving you a "deal" by getting in for $20, it's bs.

To Joe

Terrible experience some of the worse security I've seen and service being part of the goldrush rally I won't recommend ever going back, they were disrespectful didn't even believe me that the girl they escorted out was my girlfriend. There security is insane! Never had a problem in Vegas. working in San Diego downtown I know how the club seen works and security. I worked at Andaz hotel also known as ivy I know what  professionalism and they don't handle anything in a properly manner. On top of that they think they have the authority to make whatever price they please from $60 what the sing said to $80 at the ticket counter. Because of this one experience I'll make sure never to be back!

The chosen night club of my Friday night ended up being XS. We were on the list after meeting a promoter earlier in the day. Getting in at first was a bit annoying, because the bouncer legitimately thought my ID was fake for some reason. After my friends all got in and were waiting on me, he decided to walk down the hallway with it to see if the other bouncers had a blacklight. He came back and said "i'm not buying it, looks fake to me." "Whatever you say, let me just pull out my passport," I replied. Dumbfounded, he let me right in. Lol.

Once we were in the second waiting area, we waited for about 30 mins before being let into the actual club. Once we were let into the doors, wow was the view AMAZING. A huge, luxurious pool surrounded by beautiful palm trees and decor was in front of us. Since it's winter, we headed into the indoor area with the crowd. Now THIS is what I call a top of the line nightclub. It's what I envisioned when I originally pictured clubbing in Vegas, only 10x better than my imagination. The lighting, dancefloor, tables & poles everywhere were so fierce. 

I didn't have the experience I wish I would've had while at XS, but it has nothing to with the club, just personal mistakes such as having drama with a friend, wearing EXTREMELY uncomfortable shoes, and not pregaming nearly enough. So basically, I wasn't in the best mood and was really struggling in my shoes. There were wall to wall people, which is really what I like to see and be surrounded by in a club atmosphere. But I will say it was annoying waiting literally at least 45 minutes to get a drink. Girls, i'm not telling you to wear flats, but don't make the mistake of wearing killer shoes to this club like I did. Standing in line really blew and I was in too much pain to even dance. The dancefloor looked like the best time ever. The DJ booth was lit up and everyone looked like they were having the time of their lives. I'm still giving this club 4 stars because the atmospher was TRULY top of the line. I really look forward to my next visit in Vegas because I now know what & what not to do. XS, I will see you again and have an amazing time.

I must have missed something that the other 1157 reviews didn't. I personally don't enjoy waiting 30 minutes in a line for a drink, having nowhere to sit, stand, or even dance. The dance floor was so packed people couldn't barley move. I guess that's a good sign for the club owners, their business is a success. I just was disappointed; I had higher hopes for this place.

The music was good, and the outside area is awesome filled with tables you could rent out for the night. I guess I should have done that and I'm sure this review would be a five star. Why is that? You have a server bringing you drinks, a place to dance, sit or even stand if you want. =)

I love this awesome nightclub 
Me and my friend get impressed by the behaviour of bouncers, very polite and no reason to avoid anyone for nothing
David guetta came late like other events but thats didn't change anything 
Design was very attractive nd beautiful aslo there was a pool nd jacuzzi which some people went inside it 
Didn't buy any drink because i was drunk but bars were so busy .

About XS:

XSively gorgeous layout with outdoor patio pool
Drinks will XSively drain your wallet 
XSively crowded dance floor and bar area 
XSive Asians (Hot & Ugly)

How to get into XS:

Get there XSively early!
If you are female, go with an XS amount of girls (ahem all girls only) and show XS cleavage!
If you are male, bring XS money to pay cover (ranges from $20-$50) and hide your unnecessary XS cleavage!!

How to have fun at XS:

Drink XSive amount of alcohol
Leave your XS baggage and drama at home! 
Shake your bootay XSively on the dance floor!

Got here relatively early to hopefully get in without having to wait over an hour like other people at the back of the line.  How they choose to manage entry here was so strange that night.  Basically even if you're near the front of the line you won't be let in so easily.  If you know a promoter or tip one of the bouncers you'll get in a lot quicker.  I figured we all tip the bouncer $10 to get us in quick and had him on the line, a friend in the group said wait and in the end we paid $40 a head to get in anyway.  Didn't have a problem with paying this much since it was my first time checking out XS and had won some money anyway. 

After that, excitement starts to set in after walking through the side entrance to enter in with the awesome outdoor pool landscape.  Secondly, the awesome quality of the sound system which is smartly hidden into the architecture and landscape.  Probably cost them millions for this incredible acoustic setup.  Found out this place is like 40K sq. ft. which is probably the biggest club I've been to.  And yes they have a number of tables on the island area of the pool, which can be useful.  Just make sure you're gambling before you get your drink on.

The drinks aren't insanely expensive like I've heard they might be.  I remember buying like four shots of patron for like $53 including tip.  Dance floor area is cool but too tight with how many people are there.  Lounge areas are good and the pool view is sweet everywhere. Honestly, I can see why this place is the one of the best clubs in the US but supposedly it's losing its luster as newer Vegas clubs open up and compete.

Beautiful CLUB and this place is freaken HUGH. Me and 14 of my girls headed out to XS after our dinner @ Switch.   Lines were hella long, but as long as you get there early enough the line moves fast.  We drank and danced all night.  My sister had passes to XS but not enough and the resturant Switch also gave us additional passes. When in vegas you can find me back at this club dancing w\/ my shoes off in the pool! ;-)

-p2

3 Stars

I would give 4 stars, but one was deducted...I'll get to this later. 
The line was really long, but our friends were inside already w\/ bottle service, so we got in w\/o waiting. music was great, the place was maybe a little too packed, but it was a cool setup. A lot of Affliction shirt wearing toughguy types, but a decent mix of others too.
The couches at our table were comfortable, and there was a room to dance on the platform next to the couch.....even a pole if you're in that mood...
Drinks at the bar were ok...overpriced.....but it's vegas, everything is overpriced right?
Bathrooms were clean....and there's an outside area if u wanna get some fresh air. 
Only big problem were the bouncers at the front. I overheard them swearing and talking about people that were walking in the club......sounded like personal issues, but it gives a bad impression of the club.

Wow. XS might be my favorite place in the world to party. Thank the lord my friend had some solid Vegas connections. From what I hear, it's hard enough to get into this club typically, but on Labor Day Weekend no less? Forget it. We arrived to a line filled with hopefuls that snaked out of the check-in area and down the long hallway. After some initial confusion, we found the VIP check-in located in a really random banquet hall section that backed up to the club. There was not one man in the line, which says it all about the nightlife scene in Vegas. Guys better have some really solid connections or drop mad dough if they want to party at the hot spots. 

The line moved quickly and we entered into the patio area. Drinks were crazy expensive, and although we had pregamed extensively, it was our last night of the trip so we wanted to go out big.

We walked around a bit then parked ourselves on the patio for a while, where we danced, people-watched and just enjoyed the night. Then we decided to head inside the club, where will.i.am was spinning. I must have been walking around with a glow because it just felt like people were extra friendly and having a great time. I didn't really experience any of the pushing, shoving or bitchface that I had noticed at the other clubs that week. 

Our night at XS is just one element of what made for an unforgettable weekend with some of my favorite girls, but I am already contemplating my next trip out.
The staff was rude. They separate guys and ladies which causes the group to be delayed and entering at different times. Club was OK. Not worth the hassle.

This was the worst clubbing experience I've ever had. Promoter Eric Shine offered my group a table outside at an all inclusive rate of 1,400 (tip, tax, drinks) and then offered an upgraded table inside for 1,500. We booked the table inside. When we arrived Eric was not present to escort us in and the staff at XS said we could not have a table inside. We were charged 2,000+ for the outside table. It took over 40 minutes for drinks to arrive to our table, bouncers wouldn't let us on the dance floor because it was overcrowded, and we had to listen to Wonderwall. If I wanted to throw money away, listen to outdated acoustic songs, and stare at a mass of sinners dressed to the nines I would go to a church. I will actively discourage everyone I know from attending XS.

After a couple of hours at Tryst, we decided to check out XS. We should have stayed at Tryst!!!! We were moved to the front of the line but still had to pay $20 in cover...we weren't on a guest list. The drinks were overpriced (expected) but not strong. Everyone was already plastered, we weren't drunk enough to be there. Maybe I would have enjoyed it more if I went after 7 more vodka tonics. But I enjoy everything more then :) It was crowded with people bumping into you, dancing inappropriately on you, falling all over etc. Now don't get me wrong...dancing is fine but when it's to the point where my "innocent" midwestern friends say "they're probably going to leave soon to have sloppy sex " its a little too much. On the plus side, I like the outdoor space and the decor!

We were considering bottle service vs just normal tickets, and since there's no way to reserve a bottle from the website, we purchased tickets to ensure they wouldn't sell out, then sent an inquiry for bottle service.

Bottle service normally includes free entry so I asked if they could credit the tickets we already bought - about $100 - against the bottle price, so we wouldn't be paying twice for entry.

Surprised to get an initial flat "no" response from the host Mike Glenn, I volunteered that I realize XS doesn't get the full ticket sale price, and I'd be happy to be credited whatever XS receives and eat the service fee or other cost-of-sale for XS.  And that he could scan the tickets when we purchase the bottle to make sure no one else would use them.

Still a flat "no" - no discount offered at all.

Really quite amazed.  We would have had a deal if Mike budged at all, even tossed out a discount of $50.  I've purchased bottle service many times, never seen such an unreasonable host.

Cannot believe how packed it was the last time I went!

Deadmau5 was spinning that night.  The whole venue was packed, including outside at the pool area.  There was not that much walking space so my friends and I walked to a spot that was sort of free.  We mingled with guys at the table area where we decided to stay.  Turned out they had a friend there with them who I went to school with.  I ended up hanging out with him and his friends the whole time.  It was good vibes.  And before we left, my friend had lost her shoe.  She had placed them behind the lounge chair at the pool.  We think it floated away or someone took the wrong shoe.  I had looked into the water to see if it floated out somewhere, then noticed this couple banging in the water lol

I really don't know why the ratings for this place is so high. The line is ridiculously long and slow. Unless you are willing to pay the bouncer some $$$ be ready to wait at least an hour in line. I don't mind waiting in line, but once I was in it was a complete sausage fest. The ratio was so messed up omg it was like 10 guys to 1 girl on a Friday night. The positive thing, it is a nice big club and I like the outdoor area to chill.

This club is hands down the best one in Vegas! All the hottest and best DJs are always playing and the venue is amazing! Great lights, graphics and animation! I've always had a blast here and I've never been disappointed. My friends and I always go to XS when we go to Vegas and promoters in Vegas are a lot more accommodating than the ones were used to in LA, especially Carlos Reyes! We've gotten into sold out nights during Labor Day weekend on his guest list and we they're always unforgettable! Thanks Carlos and we'll be sure to be back this summer!
XS nightclub is beautiful. Best club I've ever seen. And I'm not just writing this cause I DJ there. LOL It really is like nothing else & I've been to nightclubs all over the world.

Im not gonna say too much, other then wow. I was completely blown away by this club. I was everything you could have asked for in a club and then 20 times more. Bottle Service with Stripper Poles, a Huge swimming pool, floating sofas, Beautiful People, it was amazing! GOOD MUSIC TOO! 

i'll be coming back again real soon!

XS. Excellent!  X marks the Spot. This is where some of my most favorite Dj's reside.  Good heavens look at the line up for resident Dj's.  This is home to Kaskade, Zedd, Avicii and David Guetta.  Skrillex is here too.  Holy son of a beep beep!  Dj heaven!  My Vegas love gets me VIP to XS because of my favorite Dj's.  I show up and I'm escorted passed a very long line of sexy stiletto's and given top shelf drink tickets.  Thank you well dressed Vegas love.  I walk towards the island bar and outside gambling area.  This is just classy as hell! I'm loving the glitz, attractive decor, glam Cabana's, the VIP section is sexy like a model.  Chealeedah!  Ow! Good gawd!  The music is just what I've been craving to hear.  I entered through the rear by the pool.  The Dj stand is right at the edge of inside and outside.  That's what makes this club unique.  If you're inside you have the view of the beautiful pool area.  If you're outside you have the view of the Wynn towers and the entire layout.  You can dance in the pool if you are on a good buzz. If you want a classy club with world renowned Dj's.  This is where you want to be.  No other hotel has a Dj residency line up list like XS.

WARNING!!! AVOID THIS CLUB

XS used to be my favorite club in the world. But recently they have implemented a new system where they combined the Presale Line with the General Admission line. So even if you buy tickets before hand, you are still forced to wait HOURS before you are allowed in because the bouncers want to charge you extra money to go in the "expedited line". What the hell is the point of selling online tickets then? This is the only club in Vegas with this stupid rule and sorry I am NOT waiting 2 hours in that line when you purposely hold it up to make more money. And I am definitely not paying your greedy asses more money to get in faster. I'll just go have a great night at the many other new clubs that have opened and don't do this stupid crap.

Can XS management or any yelp users who have been recently confirm that this is the new policy or just the actions of a few greedy bouncers?

One of the better and classier clubs in Las Vegas!
Here's the worst kicker.
$8 for soda water from the gun, basically carbonated tap - almost unforgivable
Come on Babe, REALLLY?!?!  
[Source: I used to be a Bartender]

My friend found a one hundred dollar bill on the ground by the bar. This fact alone qualifies my 4-star rating.

Besides the bar, my favorite area is definitely the cabana section by the pool but wherever you are, it's always a good time. Even if you end up in the Triage area...

On my most recent trip, I also became aware of how responsive the security is. Thank goodness they're there to deal with the belligerent crazies who can't handle their shizz.

new "it" club in vegas. the venue is HUGE. the decor is over the top, typical steve wynn status. if you like tryst you'll like this place. really really similar except for the fact that the dance floor isn't puny and claustrophobic. I can't wait to see what this place will be like in the summer when the outside will be more utilized!

Gueslist for 1 girl and 2 guys. my 2 guy friends bought a ticket $100 each to get inside and outside club. ended up waiting for 3 hours to get inside.  NEED TO pay the bouncer $100 to let us in?!!!?!!?! Super corrupt people!! cant believe it

So far, this is my favorite club in Vegas. A gorgeous design, especially the outdoor pool and cabana area. They even have casino tables outside. Reserving an area can get expensive but it's worth it. If it's not a very busy weekend it might not even be that bad. My group of 15 which was a mix of guys and girls, was able to get one of the tables outside with bottle service on a sat night for roughly $100 a person. 

I had a fabulous time drinking and dancing. My husband (who drank too much) had and I quote, the best nap of his life outside on the plush lawn chairs and under the stars. No matter how you decide to spend your time at XS, it is sure to be a night to remember!

This is my favorite club in Las Vegas! The venue is massive and has a great atmosphere. The instant you walk in, you're amazed with the atmosphere of the place. Great decor, great service, great ambiance. 

The venue has an outdoor pool area that you have to walk through to get to the indoor area. It has two bars inside and one outside. They book great acts and every time I have been here, I've had a flawless experience. Just be sure to get in line around 9:30 because it gets pretty packed.

After epic fails at TAO & Tryst, my friends & I were able to get into XS. This club was crackin'. The set up was amazing. Poles everywhere. Gogo dancers in random spots at the club. Pool side tables to chill at. I'm into the whole electro hiphop mashups & all so the music was good for me. I wish that they did play more hip hop tho. 

I'd definitely go to this club again when I hit up Vegas.

I've been to XS a few times now and have always had a good experience!  I celebrated my birthday there this past weekend on a Friday night and we got there around 11 pm.  We got bottle service and were told by the bouncer that we had to tip him $300 to get a table by the dance floor, or else we would get a cabana outside.  We opted to save the $300 and got a cabana.  The cabana was one of the closer ones to the dance floor, it was really big, and can seat up to 20 people.  The girls not wanting bottle service were on a guest list and got in shortly after us (along with one of the guys who got a pre-paid ticket).  One of the other guys waited in the regular line for almost 2 hours.  Always a lot of Asian people.

My 900th review is dedicated to the best night I had in 2014! I went here with my girlfriends to see David Guetta and had a blast. Beautiful nightclub and a lot of attractive people here ;). This club is pretty big, especially the outside area. I read somewhere this club was influenced by the curves of the human body... sounds kinda silly but once you see the club and the layout... it makes sense, lol.

Getting drinks from the bar was pretty easy, as the bar is big and bartenders are fast. If you go with a group of girls, find a promoter and score free drink tickets! My girlfriends and I were literally on the dancefloor for 3 hours straight, no joke! All sober, no bar or bathroom breaks! I couldn't believe time passed by that fast. The club had good air conditioning, which is important...it kept us going lol. 

As for leaving the club with a taxi, expect to wait a long time. We saw a huge line that pretty much crowded the entrance... seeing that we decided to walk back to the Cosmo which took us 20 minutes so we can grub on our 5AM pizza :) 

XS always grabs the best DJs for every weekend. Definitely can't wait to come back here and go loca.

Came in tonight with a big group of girls & my boyfriend (the bday girl already had a table for us) They wouldn't let him in because of is shoes which were very nice sneakers. While walking out I noticed a bunch of dudes wearing sneakers as well & they were able to get in. This place should really be more clear on the dress code on their website (which I checked earlier) I'm pretty upset, not that I couldn't go but that now my boyfriend is now upset with me. Thanks XS.

I'm an XS fan. 

There really isn't that much not to love. The grounds are large and sprawling, it's both indoor and out, and it's beautiful. Unlike traditional clubs where you pretty much have to pay for a table to get a seat, there are places everywhere to plop down and take rest or have a chat with other people. Drink lines are short and bathrooms are clean and fast.

Our night went off without a hitch. We had a fabulous time dancing the night (and morning) away. Skrillex killed it on the DJ stage, and by the end of the evening, our shoes were off and we were in the pool continuing the fun much more comfortably. What a great perk to have a pool at the club!
Celebrated my boys 40th bday and Brian Pfeiffer in Las Vegas VIp host for XS set up the best table!

i loved loved loved this club. went here for a weekend gettaway with the bride to be and i had so much fun! had to wait in the guest list line but it was all for free for us to get in. We probably waited 15 mins tops from the time we got there. We mostly stayed and danced outside, it was very spacious. I dont know about the price ranges of the drinks, but im assuming it was expensive. The DJ that night was good. I was dancing all night. The security guards were nice too, took pictures of us and let us dance in the pool at the end of the night. When we did go inside to dance we probably stayed in there for a few min cuz it was super packed inside. Outside was nice and more room to boogie! Def would come back here again to party!

This place was pretty hyped up to me by friends and also even random taxi drivers etc who all agreed that this was the nightclub to go to in Vegas.  Because of late planning and it being Friday night, we had to pay $20 a person (I believe that's what it is for women and men have to pay $30?).  Also, drinks were pricey at $12-$14 for a shot and $16 for strong drinks like a Long Island or AMF.

So, why 5 stars?  Well, in short, this place was absolutely amazing!!  Soooo big and nice and pretty and awesome.  Lots of bars so you're not crammed at one trying to get a drink, lots of places to sit both inside and out, great poolside and a poolside bar you can walk up to, cool dance floor that is open to the outside so that if you need space, you could potentially just move closer to the outside.  Music that's loud but not too loud, crowd that's diverse and cool and well-dressed.

Bottom line: once you go, you get why people love this place.  And even though it's expensive, I loved it!  I could live here forever if they let me haha.

Prior to this weekend here in Vegas, or specifically XS, I really hated clubs. Okay, maybe not hated but if it was my birthday, it definitely wouldn't have been something I wanted to, drunk or sober, because I never really liked dancing. With the right amount of booze, that reluctance for the most part, levitates away with ease at XS, with the atmosphere, the music, and the personable ease at which we walked into the club. I felt comfortable and only paid $20 to get into the club, versus Haze, the other club that we went to in Vegas, which was $40. The crowd was pretty racially diverse as a different user pointed out, and for the fellas (or ladies) that are single and curious, the eye-candy is much better here than at Haze. 

The music for the most part, focuses on trance and house, with a little bit techno, remixing some popular songs from American top 40, as well as British top 40. I heard a few classic electronica songs as well, like Iio's Rapture, and Paul Oakenfold's Starry Eyed Surprise, so make sure that's your cup of tea before you enter the club. I don't know how hard it is to get into the club but I went with 9 girls, so there was not a problem. It seems some of the more negative reviews are just complaining about the music or a bad personal experience that was specific to that day.

I would write more about this place (and really want to) but honestly, I was just pretty damn drunk, having an amazing time, and thoroughly enjoying everything. Maybe that skews the review a little, but compared to experiences at Haze and Tao, this place deserves its five-star rating. I'll be heading back to Vegas for my birthday with my friends and this spot will definitely be one of the clubs that we'll be returning to. Definitely the classiest club that I've ever been to.

Each time I go to Vegas this is my favorite place of the trip. It has the hottest guys and best music. It has gambling inside if you want. Also, ladies get free champaign for an hour if you get there in the beginning. The beds outside create a great atmosphere and there are plenty of places to sit outside if you get too hot dancing inside.

EPIC...

OK, I know that one word reviews are frowned upon so I guess I will elaborate.  We came here to see Calvin Harris and the venue did not disappoint.  We are not Vegas rookies so we looked over our checklist...

1. More females than males in the group...Check!
2. More clothes on the 2 dudes than on all the females combined...Check!
3. Early arrival...Check!
4. More females than males in the group...yep, still a Check!!  
5. Pre-flights complete...Check
6. Group text of Hotel address and room number...Check 

Tickets in hand, we took to the club!  What an experience.  The music was amazing, the vibe was all energy and the scene was...EPIC!!!  Plenty of bars, the drinks were standard Vegas pricing...way too much for not much drink...the dance floor was small but the club is sooooo big when you include the pool area and the music is all around so you can party just about anywhere you want!!  

The only bad part of my experience was my fault...I broke a cardinal rule and allowed the ladies to do the group bathroom thing which left my hommie and I outside alone...they decided to stay in the club and as expected...when we tried to get in, the bouncer looked at the two of us and said...sorry, capacity crowd...then proceeded to let a group of 5 lone ladies in as he pushed us aside....errrrr!!!  Never split up the group!!  The ladies came out to continue partying in the pool area so we continued to have a great time!!

Hands down the nicest place I've ever been to, and not just for a club! This venue is BEAUTIFUL and the open area with the pool just takes it to the next level. Plenty of space, even when it gets packed at 1 am on a Saturday night I could still find a place to sit down and rest my tired feet from the night before at Vanity. The only reason I knock a star off is that the dance floor gets way too crowded to dance and I really wanted to dance once the vodka got flowing in me! Huge dance floor but just way too many people packed in. I would also like to point out the fact that you can also gamble in here! Blackjack tables are just what my bf loved. The fact that he had good luck and won a little money didn't hurt either :)

Obviously this club is cool in that they have a great pool setting and a cool atmosphere, but when we dig deeper this club is not that great depending on the night you visit, how busy it is in Vegas when you visit,or if your a boy or a girl (hot).

So here is my experience on a busy saturday night:

1) Get in line boys. There are two large rooms off the corridor that they keep hundreds of people lined up like cattle, which in reality is unnecessary (More later). The waiting rooms are hot (temperature hot)  and the uninitiated have no idea how long the wait is because after zig zagging thru one room you think hey we are there , but no there is one other room to navigate..

2) The wait on a busy night is about 1 hr plus, such a buzz killer and makes you think why bother....yawn (Is it really that cool?). As you get to the second room in line, the bouncer offers quick entry for a big fee. Normal entry is 50 dollars for guys on Saturday, the bouncer will offer to let you skip this last room for a fee of 20 to 50 dollars. So if your willing to pay 100 dollars to get in then you can skip the last 30 to 45 mins of the line.

3) Now you wait and wait and get near the place we pay. The line comes to an almost grinding halt the closer you get, because all the hot girls or people on the list always take preference.   Now I am at the front of the line. I am looking at 4 ladies waiting to take my money but the bouncers or staff controlling the line keep us like cattle in line with a closed gate ??. I have my fifty dollars waiting, the women staff  are waiting to take my money but the bouncers have the gate closed. WTF. The reality is (THE WAIT IS ARTIFICIAL), and is made to make us pay early in the line to skip this miserable wait. Pretty stupid because if they really made an efficient process we would be spending money in the club on drinks in the club. The price to get in the club is $50 for guys , $20 for girls.

4) So now we get in and this last weekend was very busy in Vegas. The place is wall to wall people. Not enough room to just stand , let alone dance. So we go out to the pool area. Wow, again so busy its wall to wall to wall people. We get a drink, ha now four deep at the bar and another 20 minute wait to buy overpriced drinks. Last night a beer was $10 instead of $8 the week before. The price changes depending on demand (Unethical).

5) Hey, now after one and a half hrs we are in the club, with a drink in our hand. So we scan the ladies. Guys XS women are very variable, much depends on the night you go. In the week they have more Euro vacationers. Last night a high percentage of women were pretty sketchy (LA crowd) . Wow did we really pay all this money, wait all this time to find the place crazy busy with no where to relax, and  to find the women are much better looking in the street and in the hotel and hotel bars. Too many trashy people gives the club a bad vibe, and gave me the impression of why did I do this. I am a sucker coming here. Simply not worth the trouble.

So unless you a female that is hot and  you get in for free and get free drinks from the drooling guys my vote is forget it. Guys you can find better women in the street and hotel for free, without this stupid chaos of clubbing.

XS needs to be much more selective in who they let in and they need to stop trying to flees us with artificial long lines, with the incentive of frustrating us so we pay the bouncer to skip the line.

I have had good nights at XS, but last night was a complete rip.. Buyer beware..The club owners are just greedy, and have no care as to our experience. We are just objects with an ATM card.

Get on a guestlist!

XS is an incredible venue capable of an incredible party on any given night. They consistently book world class house\/techno DJs and promote very well. There was an abundance of space, different bars, dance areas and fun loving people. It would be pretty hard for someone to not have a good time here, honestly its a must visit if you can.

However, the problem with XS is that just about everyone knows about it's (deserved) reputation as an incredible venue. Due to it's popularity among locals and tourists, it can be incredibly difficult and pricey to get into. On the Saturday night I was there, they literally stopped letting people in around midnight and had a sign saying that guys would have to pay a $100 cover. Yes, you read that right gentlemen, $100 to get into a club if you are not on a guestlist...madness.

So, to save yourself the pain, please do your research on instagram or through your hotel's front desk to figure out a way to get on a guestlist and please please please arrive early. If your friends are lagging behind, then just leave them and go in on time and have a blast lol.

First of all LOL at "AJ S." review from June 3 about how his card was declined because Chase bank went down LOL! Anyway, place is awesome but I have some complaints I want to air anyway. Bartenders are terribly slow and most of them are bitchy. I think they are slow on purpose and they move with zero urgency when the bar is 4 people deep all the way around. If you are a bartender there and youre not bitchy or slow than this doesnt apply to you. Im only talking about the 3 that I encountered. Twice it took almost 30 minutes to get a drink. Bouncers up front and outside are not bad, the ones inside were rude morons. If you bounce there and are not a rude moron than this doesnt apply to you. Im only referring to the few that I observed. Saw a black lady security guard shoo a bunch of girls from a blackjack table as if they had no right to be in there. Listen honey, people pay big money to come to XS and spend even more on the inside. Treat them with respect.

XS is one of the better clubs in Vegas and has a gorgeous venue with the huge pool and outdoor bars. They play a good variety of music and the go-go dancers are pretty hot. The crowd differs but sometimes you run into obnoxious people or guys who are looking for a fight. I've seen the fights and champagne being dumped on people. Yes, the drinks are overpriced and yeah, it's flooded with Asians (I am Asian and I don't give a crap) but if you don't like it, go to a different club. It can get insanely crowded and I can't believe people wait in that ridiculous line to get in. Get to know the right people so you can skip the line and get in w\/o any entrance charge. 5 stars because Vegas puts up a great looking club and I don't have to spend any $ on entrance or drinks just cuz I'm a girl :)

Hands down BEST CLUB IN LAS VEGAS, dont waste your time going anywhere else.  This place bleeds luxury and sexyness.  Its huge, beautiful, new, simply the best, and too much fun.  The music is great, the crowd is stoked because the club is so nice and its just a great experience everyone should check this place out..  I felt like a prince in this place, top of the chain service very mixed crowd met people from all over the world here....the pools pretty cool I wonder if you can swim in it just a bunch of girls with there feet standing in the 4 inch standing part pretty cool...

My boyfriend and I love this Venue, it's always a great time with the hottest DJ's they always have booked. It's beautiful with it's outdoor setting and open spaces around a gorgeous sparkling pool. We always get in quickly thanks to our Promotor Chris, who constantly ensures a great expperience with his fast responses and great promos! If your going o Vegas XS is the club to take yourself and your friends to! Text Chris at 1(702)722-8585, find him on FB at Chris Cowette at XS, instagram at XSLVNV or twitter @TheListByChris!!!!

Best club in Vegas in my opinion. No stairs like Marquee! Open area w. lots of seating with a pool to dip your feet in or swim in if you are up for it! Lines get long so unless you know someone or have bottle service, get there early.

Would love to talk to the manager of this amazing club that is doing way below its potentials die to huge mistakes by whomever is responsible for choosing security measures. As a 10 years consultant of live nation I understand importance of security but this place is taking stupidity to the next level by adding extra time and lines. I stood 1:20 min in a line that should have taken 20 min max in such high level clubs.
News flash for manager: searching a girl with cocktail dress twice , not going to make your club safe but will make people like me intelligent enough to know you have freaking glass bottle that is way more usable or dangerous versus lipgloss!!! 
I was searched twice and stood in line twice before getting in. 
If you like to know what is practical and what is not. I be happy to talk to you but tonight I walked in angry. Maybe you guys got used to tourism not people who care to be respected when they spent $300.

I'm a local and have lived in Vegas for 6 months. Been wanting to go out with my boyfriend and hit up some clubs, but have found that it cost men so much to enter clubs. So, I went online and searched for Promoters and found Chris!! I wasn't for sure if it was a real deal or not, but decided to sign us up to go to XS last Sunday night. Got to the club early to make sure we didn't have to wait in a very long line. We were the second couple into the VIP side! A total plus there. 

The guest list check-in was at a door that let you enter the pool area as soon as you were checked in. I loved that. The pool area was so pretty and so unreal. Since we were there and checked in at 10, we had our choice of any of the lounges on the edge of the pool. Yet another plus! My boyfriend and I didn't realize it was Sunday Swim Night, so I was dressed in a dress and he was in pants and shirt.
